data.question: What is the chemical formula for the oxyiminodiacetate ligand?
What unique structural feature does the [Bis(oxyiminodiacetate)aquazirconium(IV)] complex possess?
How are the two q2-N,O groups oriented in the eight-coordinate structure of isolated amavadin?
data.answer: Mutually trans and oriented at about 90 degrees to one another

data.question: What is the coordination number of the Zr(IV) center in the [Bis(oxyiminodiacetate)aquazirconium(IV)] complex?
What method was used to characterize the [NH4][NMe4][V(hida)2] complex?
What is the role of CaCl2 in the synthesis of complex 1?
data.answer: It is added to the solution before concentrating under reduced pressure

data.question: What happens to the dihedral angle between the two (q2-N,O)M groups as the size of the metal increases?
Why is nine-coordination considered novel for Zr(IV) in coordination chemistry?
data.answer: Because coordination numbers higher than eight are uncommon for Zr(IV) complexes

data.question: What causes the distortion from a regular geometry in amavadin-like coordination geometry?
How does the synthesis of the Zr compound differ from that of the Ti compound?
data.answer: The Zr compound is prepared analogously but uses [Zr(acac)4] instead of [TiO(acac)2]

data.question: What is the significance of the water molecule coordinated to the zirconium center in the Zr(IV) complex?
data.answer: It contributes to the nine-coordinate structure of the complex

data.question: What structural feature is shared by the anion of complex 1 with other complexes of (hida)3- and (hidpa)3-?
data.answer: The same structure as reported for the complexes with V(IV), V(V), Mo(V), Nb(V), and Ta(V)

data.question: Is the Ti-O bond length in complex 1 shorter than that observed in the V(IV) and V(V) complexes?
Does the Zr(IV) complex contain a water molecule coordinated to the zirconium center?
Are the Ti-N bond lengths in complex 1 similar in length to the equivalent bonds of the V(IV) complex?
Is nine-coordination a common structural feature for bis-ligand complexes with (hida)3-?
Does the crystal structure of the Ti complex contain 24-membered rings formed from three [Ti(hida)2]- anions and three [Ca(H2O)6]2+ cations?
Are the macrocycles in the Ti complex connected through the Ti and Ca units?
Is the synthesis of complex 1 and the Zr compound performed at a temperature above 22Â°C?
Does the Zr(IV) complex exhibit a ten-coordinate structure?
